definitions: remove the testicles of a male animal to prevent reproduction
examples: The farmer decided to geld the young stallion last spring
They geld most male horses to make them calmer

definitions: make a broad statement based on specific examples or limited information
apply something more widely to include more cases or situations
examples: Don't generalize about teenagers based on just two examples
Scientists generalize their findings after studying hundreds of cases
The company plans to generalize this policy across all departments
We can generalize this solution to work for similar problems

definitions: start to grow or sprout from a seed when conditions are right
begin to develop or come into existence over time
examples: The seeds will germinate in warm, moist soil within days
Most vegetable seeds germinate best at temperatures above sixty degrees
The idea began to germinate in her mind during the meeting
Plans for the new project germinated over several months

definitions: make someone feel happy or pleased about something
examples: The surprise party will gladden her heart after a tough week
Good news from the doctor gladdened the whole family

definitions: look at someone or something with an angry or fierce expression
shine with a strong, harsh, dazzling light that hurts the eyes
examples: She continued to glare at him across the dinner table
The teacher glared at the students who were talking
The sun glared off the car's windshield making it hard to see
Bright lights glare from the stage during the performance

definitions: cover something with a smooth, shiny coating or finish
become dull and unfocused like glass, especially eyes
examples: The potter will glaze the ceramic bowls before the final firing
She decided to glaze the donuts with chocolate icing
His eyes began to glaze over during the boring presentation
Her eyes glazed with exhaustion after working all night

definitions: shine brightly with a soft, reflected light
examples: The polished silver gleamed on the dining room table
Her eyes gleamed with excitement when she heard the news

definitions: collect information or material slowly and carefully from various sources
examples: She managed to glean useful information from old newspaper articles
Researchers glean data from hundreds of different studies

definitions: move along smoothly and continuously with little effort or sound
examples: The ice skater glided gracefully across the frozen pond
The swan glided silently through the calm morning water

definitions: shine with a weak or wavering light
examples: Stars glimmer faintly through the clouds on a hazy night
A candle glimmered in the window of the old house

definitions: see or look at something or someone for a very short time
examples: I glimpsed a deer running through the forest this morning
She glimpsed her favorite actor at the crowded restaurant

definitions: experience a sudden, temporary malfunction or irregularity in operation
examples: The computer system glitched during the important presentation yesterday
The video game glitches whenever too many players join

definitions: shine brightly with many small flashes of reflected light
examples: The diamond necklace glittered under the bright chandelier lights
Fresh snow glittered in the morning sunlight

definitions: praise and worship someone or something, especially a deity
describe or represent something as better or more important than reality
examples: The congregation gathered to glorify God through songs and prayers
Ancient poems glorify the deeds of legendary heroes
Movies often glorify violence without showing its real consequences
Don't glorify his mistakes by calling them brave choices

definitions: give out a steady light without flame
show a warm, healthy appearance or strong positive emotion
examples: The coals continued to glow long after the fire died
Fireflies glow in the dark to attract mates
Her face glowed with happiness on her wedding day
The proud parents glowed as their daughter received the award

definitions: join or attach things together using adhesive substance
examples: She carefully glued the broken vase back together
The children glued colorful paper shapes onto their art projects

definitions: supply or provide something in amounts that exceed demand or need
examples: Farmers glutted the market with tomatoes causing prices to drop
Publishers glut bookstores with celebrity memoirs every year

definitions: provoke or annoy someone to stimulate them into action or reaction
examples: His friends goaded him into asking his crush to dance
The coach goaded the team to practice harder

definitions: make a silly or careless mistake or error
spend time fooling around or behaving in a silly way
examples: I really goofed when I sent the email to the wrong person
She goofed on the math test by misreading the question
The kids goofed around in the backyard all afternoon
Stop goofing off and finish your homework

definitions: search for information on the internet using the Google search engine
examples: Let me google that restaurant to find their phone number
She googled the symptoms before calling her doctor

definitions: poke or pinch someone suddenly, typically on the bottom
examples: His brother tried to goose him as he walked past
Someone goosed her in the crowded elevator

definitions: pierce or wound with a horn, tusk, or sharp object
examples: The bull gored the matador during the dangerous performance
Wild boars can gore hunters with their sharp tusks

definitions: eat large amounts of food quickly and greedily
examples: They gorged themselves on pizza after the long hike
Don't gorge on junk food before dinner

definitions: engage in casual talk about other people's private lives or affairs
examples: The neighbors love to gossip about everyone on the street
They gossiped for hours about their coworkers at lunch

definitions: make a hole or groove by scooping or cutting roughly
charge someone unfairly high prices for goods or services
examples: The cat gouged deep scratches in the leather sofa
Workers gouged channels in the wood for the wiring
The hotel gouged tourists with extremely high prices during the festival
Gas stations often gouge customers when there's a shortage

definitions: transplant living tissue from one part to another surgically
insert or attach one thing to another to form a union
examples: Surgeons will graft skin from his thigh to cover the burn
Doctors grafted bone from her hip to repair her jaw
The gardener grafted apple branches onto the pear tree
Scientists graft different plant varieties to create hybrids

definitions: perform or act in a showy way to impress an audience
examples: The politician loves to grandstand during televised committee hearings
Stop grandstanding and just answer the question honestly

definitions: engage in a close fight or struggle without weapons
examples: The wrestlers grappled on the mat for several minutes
She continues to grapple with difficult math concepts

definitions: reduce food to small pieces by rubbing against a rough surface
irritate or annoy someone with a harsh sound or manner
examples: Please grate the cheese for the pasta dish
She grated fresh ginger into the stir-fry
His constant complaining really grates on my nerves
The chalk grated against the blackboard

definitions: move toward or be attracted to a place, person, or thing
examples: Students naturally gravitate toward teachers who show genuine interest
People gravitate to the snack table at parties

definitions: feed on growing grass or pasture
touch or scrape something lightly in passing
examples: Cattle graze peacefully in the meadow all day
Sheep graze on the hillside during summer months
The bullet grazed his shoulder but didn't cause serious injury
She grazed her knee when she fell off her bike

definitions: apply oil or fat to something to reduce friction or prevent sticking
examples: Remember to grease the baking pan before adding the batter
The mechanic greased all the moving parts of the engine

definitions: give permission or approval for something to proceed
examples: The studio finally greenlit the movie after years of development
Management greenlit our proposal for the new marketing campaign

definitions: become grey in color, especially hair with age
examples: His hair started to grey in his early thirties
The sky greyed as storm clouds moved in

definitions: feel intense sorrow, especially following the death of someone
examples: She continues to grieve for her husband two years later
The whole community grieved when the beloved teacher passed away

definitions: cook food on a metal frame over fire or hot coals
question someone intensely and persistently about something
examples: We plan to grill burgers and hot dogs for the picnic
Dad loves to grill vegetables on the barbecue
The detective grilled the suspect for three hours
Reporters grilled the CEO about the company's losses

definitions: cover or become covered with thick dirt or filth
examples: Years of neglect had grimed the windows beyond recognition
Soot from the factory grimed every surface in town

definitions: smile broadly showing teeth, especially to express amusement
examples: The baby grinned happily when she saw her mother
He couldn't help but grin at the silly joke

definitions: reduce something to small particles or powder by crushing
work hard for long periods at tedious or difficult tasks
examples: The coffee shop grinds fresh beans for each cup
Use this mill to grind pepper for the recipe
Students grind through homework assignments every night
She had to grind for months to pass the bar exam

definitions: clench teeth together, especially to show determination or endure pain
examples: She gritted her teeth and continued running despite the pain
He gritted his teeth to keep from crying out

definitions: clean and maintain appearance of oneself or an animal
prepare or train someone for a particular purpose or position
examples: She groomed her horse carefully before the competition
He groomed his beard every morning before work
The company groomed her for the leadership position
They're grooming their son to take over the family business

definitions: make a long narrow channel or depression in something
dance or enjoy oneself to rhythmic music
examples: The carpenter grooved the wood to fit the pieces together
Water had grooved deep channels in the rock
Everyone grooved to the band's funky music
She was grooving to her favorite song

definitions: complain or grumble persistently about trivial matters
examples: He constantly grouses about the weather no matter the season
Stop grousing about the food and just eat it

definitions: fill the spaces between tiles with a paste-like mortar
examples: We need to grout the bathroom tiles after they set
The contractor will grout the kitchen backsplash tomorrow

definitions: make a low, guttural sound of hostility in the throat
examples: The dog growled when strangers approached the house
His stomach growled loudly during the quiet meeting

definitions: dig or poke about in soil or dirt
search persistently and laboriously for something
examples: The chickens grub in the dirt looking for worms
Children love to grub around in the garden
Reporters grubbed through old files for the story
She had to grub for information about her ancestors

definitions: be reluctant to give or allow something
examples: I don't grudge him his success after working so hard
She grudged every penny spent on the repairs

definitions: make a low, short sound from the throat
examples: He grunted with effort as he lifted the heavy box
The pig grunted contentedly while eating

definitions: execute or cut something with a sharp blade that drops vertically
examples: The paper factory uses machines to guillotine large sheets
They had to guillotine the debate due to time constraints
